intro: Crotalaria franchetii, commonly known as the African spurred tortoise plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive spurred petals. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in racemose inflorescences. Its leaves are palmately compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Crotalaria franchetii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
